Package camzup.core

Class Generative

java.lang.Object
camzup.core.Generative
Direct Known Subclasses:
Simplex, Voronoi
public abstract class Generative
extends java.lang.Object
Facilitates simplex noise and voronoi patterns via hashing functions.

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    static int DEFAULT_SEED
    A default seed set to the system current time in milliseconds.
    static float STEP_2
    Factor added to 2D noise when returning a Vec2.
    static float STEP_3
    Factor added to 3D noise when returning a Vec3.
    static float STEP_4
    Factor added to 4D noise when returning a Vec4.

    Returns a signed pseudo-random number in the range [-1.0, 1.0] given a vector input and a seed, based on the vector's hash code.

  • Field Details

    • DEFAULT_SEED

      public static final int DEFAULT_SEED
      A default seed set to the system current time in milliseconds.

    • STEP_2

      public static final float STEP_2
      Factor added to 2D noise when returning a Vec2. 1.0 / Math.sqrt(2.0); approximately 0.7071067690849304f .
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • STEP_3

      public static final float STEP_3
      Factor added to 3D noise when returning a Vec3. 1.0 / Math.sqrt(3.0); approximately 0.5773502588272095f .
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • STEP_4

      public static final float STEP_4
      Factor added to 4D noise when returning a Vec4. 1.0 / Math.sqrt(4.0); 0.5f .
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

  • Method Details

    • hash

      public static int hash​(int a, int b, int c)
      A helper function to the gradient functions. Performs a series of bit-shifting operations to create a hash.
      Parameters:
      a - first input
      b - second input
      c - third input
      Returns:
      the hash

    • hash

      public static float hash​(Vec2 v, int seed)
      Returns a signed pseudo-random number in the range [-1.0, 1.0] given a vector input and a seed, based on the vector's hash code.
      Parameters:
      v - the input vector
      seed - the seed
      Returns:
      a random number
      See Also:
      Vec2.hashCode(), Float.intBitsToFloat(int), hash(int, int, int)

    • hash

      public static Vec2 hash​(Vec2 v, int seed, Vec2 target)
      Returns a vector in the range [-1.0, 1.0] given a vector input and a seed.
      Parameters:
      v - the input vector
      seed - the result
      target - the output vector
      Returns:
      the vector
